name: CustomerContract_GetAll
description: Get a range of Customer Contracts, a filter needs to be specified - ScreenId=CT301000

erp-api-background.description: If a URL value is provided, then API endpoint will be queued and executed in background. When the execution of the background operation is finished, the system will POST the response to the specified URL. The endpoint itself responds in this case with a 202-Accepted status and a reference to a state document for the background operation.

$block: This class represents a CustomerContract in CustomerContractController. Used for getting data.

$ul: **attributes**: Project attributes tab
**balance**: The top part > Balance > A read-only field that displays the sum of the balances of open invoices associated with the contract.
**contractId**: Mandatory field: The top part > Contract ID* > The unique identifier of a contract.
**contractTemplate**: Mandatory field: The top part > Contract template* > The contract template that is used as a base for the contract.
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.
**customer**: Mandatory field: The top part > Customer* > The customer associated with the contract.
**name**: Click the magnifier. > The name.
**number**
**description**: Mandatory field: The top part > Description* > The description of the contract, which includes any related comments.
**details**: Details tab >
**currentRecurring**
**currentRenewal**
**currentSetup**
**effectiveFrom**
**lines**
**pendingRecurring**
**pendingRenewal**
**pendingSetup**
**promoCode**
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.
**totalPending**
**lastModifiedDateTime**: System generated information
**location**: The top part > Location > The customer location associated with the contract.
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.
**status**: The top part > Status > The status of the contract, which is one of the following: Draft, Pending activation, Active, Expired, Cancelled, Pending update.
**summary**: Summary tab >
**activationDate**: Contract settings section > Activation date > The date to initiate the provision of the contract services.
**caseCountItem**: Contract management section > Case count item > A non-stock item used for counting cases associated with the contract.
**description**: Name of item/description
**number**: Number of item
**currency**: Mandatory field: Contract settings section > Currency* > The currency used in the contract.
**expirationDate**: Contract settings section > Expiration date > The date when the contract expires.
**gracePeriod**: Contract settings section > Grace period > The number of days after the expiration date where the contract can still be renewed.
**invoiceAccount**: Invoice information section > Account > 	The specific account that is to be invoiced for contract services.
**name**: Click the magnifier. > The name.
**number**
**invoiceLocation**
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.

**invoiceTo**: Invoice information section > Invoice to > The setting that defines the customer account to be invoiced for a contract. The following options are available: Parent account, Customer account, Specific account.

**invoicingPeriod**: Mandatory field: Invoicing schedule section > Invoicing period* > The type of invoicing schedule, which can be one of the following options: Weekly, Monthly; Quarterly, Half a year, Yearly, On demand, Statement based.
**invoicingScheduleStartsOn**: Invoicing schedule section > Invoice schedule starts on > A read-only field that displays the start date of the first invoicing period.
**lastInvoicingDate**: Invoicing schedule section > Last invoicing date > A read-only field that shows the date when the invoicing was performed most recently.
**massRenewal**: Contract settings section > Mass renewal > A check box indicating renewal of all contract at expiration date.
**nextInvoicingDate**: Invoicing schedule section > Next invoicing date > The date of the next invoicing invoice, according to the invoicing schedule.
**owner**: Contract management section > Owner > The owner of the contract.
**internalId**
**name**: The name of the particular destination of the selected type.
**number**: The identifier of the particular destination of the selected type.
**renewalPoint**: Contract settings section > Renewal point > The number of days before expiration where the renewal process are to begin.
**salesPerson**: Contract management > Salesperson > The salesperson associated with the contract.
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.
**setupDate**: Mandatory field: Contract settings section > Setup date* > The date of contract setup.
**terminationDate**: Contract settings section > Termination date > The date when the contract will be cancelled; no services will be provided.
**stateLocation**
